title: Digital Environment-Based Project Design for Electric Circuit Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic electrical theory and circuit components (beginner level)
context.additional_context: A mixed-methods research design comparing student-centered approaches using smartphone-based digital learning tools with traditional lecture-based methods. Monitoring changes in learning patterns through formative assessments, with an emphasis on circuit explanation skills linked to language domains.

learning_goals: Learners can explain and analyze basic principles of electrical circuits using smartphone-based digital tools within one week
Apply in-depth learning approaches (conceptual connections, applied problem-solving) at 80%+ through project-based activities
Surface learning (rote memorization) rates decrease by 30%+ through formative assessment

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
